intro: Entandrophragma delevoyi, commonly known as African teak, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its straight, durable timber with a fine, even texture. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. The tree is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
